Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Patient Decision Aid for Post-Mastectomy Breast Reconstruction

Trial_Design.evidence: women eligible for PMBR were randomised 1:1

Participants.evidence: Conducted at a large community teaching hospital in the Netherlands, women eligible for PMBR

Intervention.evidence: standard care alone (control) or standard care plus a pDA (intervention)

Objective.evidence: evaluated the effectiveness of a patient decision aid (pDA) for post-mastectomy breast reconstruction (PMBR) compared to high-quality standard care in reducing decisional conflict

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was decisional conflict immediately after reconstructive decision.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using block randomisation with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 134 participants were randomised between August 2020 and May 2023, with 66 in the intervention group and 68 in the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant differences were found in the primary outcome (mean difference = -2.8, 95% CI -8.4 to 2.8, p = 0.319)
